div.title: Welcome
div.pre:
Before you can start editing your new giewiki, you need to <> and set various data for the root page (making you the owner of it). This is done via the ''page properties'' dialog which looks a lot like this:
<> The data is: * ''Title & Subtitle''
What is displayed at the top of the page and in the SiteMap, etc. * ''Owner''
Who controls the properties of this page. This would be your PenName, which initially is the same as your login name, but you can change it via the UserProfile. * ''Groups''
You may define a group (or multiple groups) of people that should have elevated access to the page. * ''Access permissions''
The level of access that various user classes should have to this page. * ''Template / Library includes''
Shows any page template or library resources that you include into this page. * ''Tags''::
Optional. When given, these will show up in the SiteMap (except ''hidden'' which will prevent a page from being included in the SiteMap). * ''Read-only options''
Various aspects of how the page looks to someone who does not have edit access: ** ''Prior versions''
Allows the reader access to prior versions of a tiddler, if they are preserved. ** ''"view" button''
Allows the reader to see the "raw" text of a tiddler, including it's markup. The page properties dialog is normally accessed via the edit menu, but for a page with no data, it opens automatically.
The login dialog is usually accessed via the button at the top of the toolset on the right.
